p: Two-step RT-qPCR was used to quantitatively validate gene expression. Total RNA from whole blood was converted into cDNA using the iScript TM cDNA Synthesis Kit (Bio-Rad). The amplification was performed in duplicate in a total volume of 10 μl containing 5 μl of iTaq Universal SYBR Green (Bio-Rad), 2 μl of 4 ng cDNA, 0.4 μl of 10 mM forward primer, 0.4 μl of 10 mM reverse primer, 2.2 μl of distilled water. The cycle conditions were as follows: 1 cycle of 95°C for 30s followed by 40 cycles of 95°C for 10s and 60°C for 30s. After amplification, melting curve analysis was carried out from 65°C to 95°C. Primers were designed using NCBI PrimerBlast ( https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/tools/primer-blast/). All primer pairs are listed in Supplementary Table 1. Peptidylprolyl isomerase A ( PPIA), Human large ribosomal protein P0 ( RPLP0), and Tata-box binding protein ( TBP) were used as reference genes for calculating the relative expression levels of other genes [ 16] The expression levels were calculated by using the 2 −ΔCt method, where ΔCt = mean Ct of target gene – mean Ct of the three reference genes.
